title: romero121
author: romero121
content: The longest-reigning British monarch Queen Elizabeth died at the age of 96 in Balmoral Castle. She was born in 1926. During her lifetime money is not at all an issue for her. Being the Queen of the Royal Family of the World could've impacted the market if she have made some statement relative to cryptocurrency. Once she received a blockchain journal and this made discussions of the Royal Family holding bitcoin.After her death, the same is being used as an opportunity and meme coin creators have made 40+ tokens on the ethereum and Binance Smart Chain. Few of which are Queen Elizabeth InuDogeGod Save The QueenLondon Bridge Is DownQueen GrowRip Queen ElizabethElizabeth IIQueen InuApart from this NFTs too have striked the market. For now few tokens have gained $200000+ trading volume.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: She is 96. She had seen a lot of sufferings in her time. I guess she's lucky enough not to see more of the sufferings that are to come. RIP Queen Elizabeth.But damn!  Anything can be monetized these days with meme tokens even the death of the Queen. If  blockchain was already alive when Micheal Jackson died, the internet will be full of meme coins already with his image doing the moonwalk. It was sort of a debate during that time when Micheal's death was monetized by spreading articles about the controversial death.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: Was surprised that they don't even respect the death of the Queen by creating a lot of meme in her name. Nevertheless, it's obvious that they will be another avenue for those pumpers and manipulators. So the best thing to do is to stay away from this kind of project and let it die. We have a lot of meme coins already, no need to add more. Rest in Peace Queen Elizabeth.

comments.author: salad daging
comments.created_time: September 09, 2022, 01:39:55 AMLast edit: September 09, 2022, 02:46:32 AM by salad daging
comments.body: Quote from: Dave1 on September 09, 2022, 01:29:43 AMWas surprised that they don't even respect the death of the Queen by creating a lot of meme in her name. Nevertheless, it's obvious that they will be another avenue for those pumpers and manipulators. So the best thing to do is to stay away from this kind of project and let it die. We have a lot of meme coins already, no need to add more. Rest in Peace Queen Elizabeth.Well this is global news on Queen Elizabeth's death and hoping for the best.For those who are trying to take advantage of this opportunity, the hype that creates tokens meme for their own benefit on the suffering of Queen Elizabeth I think it has no morals and they only think about how to get money, so stay away from scams, this kind of thing is difficult to avoid but we need our awareness to stay away her from the meme coin.edit:Source: https://twitter.com/LilMoonLambo/status/1567945940987789314

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: That these people show no regard for the Queen or the deceased still truly amazes me. Looking for a warning sign before committing to that project? Here it is. Those manipulators and pumpers resemble vultures. The most heartbreaking aspect of everything is that someone is preparing to spend his hard earned money in these scam project in the hopes of becoming rich quickly. Extremely pitiful.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: opportunists will always take some opportunitytimestamping some ICO genesis or some token NFT to be created on the very date of an event, causes an ico/token to then become significant as an item of interest. which if done right becomes a milestone in of itself. to then have value.compare that to a token/ICO genesis made in X weeks time suggesting it represents the events of today.. it would have less meaning/value. and be worthless. because its less related/significant, even if it had the same name/title/publicitybut with that all said. people only make these things for a quick profit. they dont care about the long term value/utility/future. nor wish to respect the subject involved. as long as hey can sell something for profit. thats what they will do

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Quote from: Dave1 on September 09, 2022, 01:29:43 AMWas surprised that they don't even respect the death of the Queen by creating a lot of meme in her name. Why, do you think these scumbags still have some respect left in them? They've been scamming people of their hard-earned money and life savings. If they can do that, they can also take advantage of this sad yet huge news and try to make money. After all, they're not the ones who killed the queen. They're simply making use of her death to scam innocent people for their money. These people have no guilt. You can't expect anything from these cretins.

comments.author: gunhell16
comments.body: Quote from: romero121 on September 09, 2022, 01:04:12 AMThe longest-reigning British monarch Queen Elizabeth died at the age of 96 in Balmoral Castle. She was born in 1926. During her lifetime money is not at all an issue for her. Being the Queen of the Royal Family of the World could've impacted the market if she have made some statement relative to cryptocurrency. Once she received a blockchain journal and this made discussions of the Royal Family holding bitcoin.After her death, the same is being used as an opportunity and meme coin creators have made 40+ tokens on the ethereum and Binance Smart Chain. Few of which are Queen Elizabeth InuDogeGod Save The QueenLondon Bridge Is DownQueen GrowRip Queen ElizabethElizabeth IIQueen InuApart from this NFTs too have striked the market. For now few tokens have gained $200000+ trading volume.I think this is what you are saying Sir about that matter, https://cryptonews.net/news/nft/12098683/Exploitative people will never really lose that in the business industry. As long as they earn a large amount of money, these opportunists are really good and smart, and they are good at timing.Knowing that Queen Elizabeth is popular they were able to take advantage of the opportunity to raise a large amount of money in the world of crypto space in just a few hours under the ERC20 and Binance smart chains.Imagine the Queen Elizabeth Inu immediately processed 700k$ with a trading volume of 200k$ and as of writing this immediately increased by 23, 271% on the Binance smart chain and also increased by 3708% on Uniswap and the save the queen token by 1517%, the size of the earnings of these opportunists is extreme.These are meme coins or shitcoins, but if you have the time to suddenly pump, you will be an instant millionaire. I hope I can have time to pump the meme coins I'm holding.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: romero121 on September 09, 2022, 01:04:12 AMBeing the Queen of the Royal Family of the WorldAre you for real?Maybe you wrote the topic in 1920 when the Brits were still invading and killing people around the world. Today Great Britain is more like Tiny Britain. Quote from: romero121 on September 09, 2022, 01:04:12 AMcould've impacted the market if she have made some statement relative to cryptocurrency. Once she received a blockchain journal and this made discussions of the Royal Family holding bitcoin.Didn't a member of royal family make a positive statement about bitcoin a while ago and nobody gave shit? I think it was from Spain or something.Quote from: romero121 on September 09, 2022, 01:04:12 AMAfter her death, the same is being used as an opportunity and meme coin creators have made 40+ tokens on the ethereum and Binance Smart Chain.We have a expression that would translate to "making butter out of water". The opportunists are desperate for any reason to scam people by selling them garbage. They are making such things every day with any excuse.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: That at this point in history we give importance to people who inherit positions as if we were in the Middle Ages makes me feel ashamed. Fortunately, the role they play is usually testimonial, but what is not so testimonial is the patrimony they inherit.Today everyone is talking about it and this thread is what I have yet to see. Quote from: pooya87 on September 09, 2022, 04:16:48 AMQuote from: romero121 on September 09, 2022, 01:04:12 AMBeing the Queen of the Royal Family of the WorldAre you for real?Maybe you wrote the topic in 1920 when the Brits were still invading and killing people around the world. Today Great Britain is more like Tiny Britain. LMAO.

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: These bullshit cocksucker didn’t even know how to respect to a Queen. Having too much freedom really corrupt the mind of the people just to earn money for someone popularity. These tokens should be requested to remove or block on the blockchain because they are obviously bunch of scam that wants quick buck using the queen name.I highly doubt that the Queen will make such statement for Bitcoin since she was born on old generation while he don’t have the needs to have a financial freedom.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: This has become commonplace after developers can create tokens on the ethereum chain with a low cost, scammers seem to have the space to continue to scamm, especially when something is happening, whatever it is, they won't think it's important to sympathize, for them the important thing is to make a quick profit, should be crypto lovers should no longer be involved in this way of buying tokens which will soon become trash.

comments.author: adzino
comments.body: Quote from: romero121 on September 09, 2022, 01:04:12 AMThe longest-reigning British monarch Queen Elizabeth died at the age of 96 in Balmoral Castle. She was born in 1926. During her lifetime money is not at all an issue for her. Being the Queen of the Royal Family of the World could've impacted the market if she have made some statement relative to cryptocurrency. For now few tokens have gained $200000+ trading volume.Of course people are going to take advantage of the opportunity. There are people that knows what they are doing. They will invest in those shitcoins, take their profit and leave. And then there are stupid/dumb people that will invest in those coins after the price goes up and keeps holding thinking they will make a fortune and get rich overnight. Those are the kind of people that deserves to get scammed.And then there are people like you that loves to promote scam coins.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Well, pretty much all the investors that are getting dumped on by these meme coins are also vultures who would punch the guy in line in front of them to get some pumped positions to sell, if their roles were to be reversed, so I don't feel sorry for either scammer or scammed in this case.Greed => Loss.

comments.author: Kakmakr
comments.body: This is a typical example of a saying that I once heard... it basically says... One death is another's bread!  So, they are cashing in on her death now... like a bunch of vultures.  We live in times where the dead is not even respected anymore... everything is focused on "money" and profits. Just look at the way that some people exploited the Covid pandemic. (Big Pharma made gazillions out of people's fear...)

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.created_time: September 09, 2022, 06:01:55 AMLast edit: September 09, 2022, 06:12:32 AM by CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: romero121 on September 09, 2022, 01:04:12 AMAfter her death, the same is being used as an opportunity, and meme coin creators have made 40+ tokens on the Ethereum and Binance Smart Chain. Few of which are Queen Elizabeth InuDogeGod Save The QueenLondon Bridge Is DownQueen GrowRip Queen ElizabethElizabeth IIQueen InuIt's not been up to 48hrs now since Queen Elizabeth died and several tokens have been made using her name, so to me, I see this as no different from the scam token that was made concerning the popular Netflix series titled "Squid Game" whereby the creator only pump and dump and ran away with peoples money, as that's the same thing that will happen to these "Queen Elizabeth" tokens, so the best option is to stay away and not invest in this kind of token as it will not stand the test of time

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: aswell as tokens/icos of memes created on event days of meme topic.. most of the highly overpriced ICO/tokens of any meme are never usually sold to dumb investors first..instead they are sold to the creator themself first using an alt accountEG if a creator pays out 10btc(as a pretend buyer).. to himself (as the initial owner/seller). he has ultimately in the end paid nothing, lost nothing. bar a tx fee..however now the "price" is set via publicity, which he can use as a milestone amount he expects other to payin short most NFT's are not actually traded. but just presented as being traded just to influence some interest by making other people think it must be worth something if someone else bought it

comments.author: so98nn
comments.body: Yeah this is nothing but using the viral terms of the current timeline to attract peeps and get money flushed into the donation address or newly minted coins. It’s actually disrespectful and should not be considered valid investment. Firstly, this is scam anyways. The lady had good time after modern world development and she already ran perfect nation so it might be possible they never needed to use bitcoin or need to do so in the future. The Royal family already have complete control over the mega piece of land, why they would care about bitcoin anyways.

For now few tokens have gained $200000+ trading volume.This happens every time a world event or phenomenal happens.  Remember squid game coin?  Scam.  That's all these things are.  Just know that if you stick money into these things you will end up losing it most likely.  It amazes me that no one learns to steer clear of these.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: This is what makes us call the meme coins that they are only shitcoins that grow with the hype. They use the name of the late queen to promote their shitcoins only to attract British investors and Queen lovers around the world to invest. I was surprised by the number of coins that were created after the death of Queen Elizabeth As if they were waiting for the news of her death so that they can take advantage of this opportunity to make money from those who will invest in the coin that bears the name of the queen, most of them are scam coins that I do not advise anyone to invest in.
